posts.title: Trump supporters, you make no sense to me.
posts.content:
Here’s a hot take: Trump is a disaster of a human being. To say nothing of his performance as a President. This dude, who would destroy the environment, gut social welfare programs, who disregards science, doesn’t pay taxes except to China, who won’t read the reports his staff members give him, who needs to hear his own name to stay focused, who apparently has no moral code whatsoever and who just says shit that has no basis in reality… this dude doesn’t even want to be president anymore in my opinion and yet there are still people who support him. This morning I learned that a friend of a friend, a young person from a nice family, voted for Trump. His reason? Biden’s tax plan.

That might make sense to me if Trump had put forward a tax plan of his own, or any kind of plan for that matter. (by the way it’s 3 days after election day as I write and the results still aren’t in so we’re all kind of on edge here) But there is no Trump plan. For anything. Taxes, Covid, Climate, you name it. No plan at all.

Which is apparently preferable to some people over “a plan.” I put a plan in quotes because I don’t know how else to emphasize what a basic fucking minimum I’m talking about here.

So Trump’s supporters are able to write off the fact that he doesn’t have any plans. They’re able to dismiss all the crazy shit that comes out of his mouth as ‘locker room talk’ or that he’s just misconstrued by the media. (If you can write down what he said on paper and it “sounds bad”, is that the media’s fault?) They can dismiss him ignoring the pleas of climate experts as California burns. They can even dismiss him cozying up to white supremacists and Vladimir Putin. All of that, and much more, aren’t as bad as Biden’s tax plan.

Two things come to mind: first, go fuck yourself you dumb fucking cunts. God damn I’m embarrassed to call you my countrymen. I’m sorry, that was rude but it just came out. And it’s how I feel.

Second, it’s clearly not about taxes here. It’s about something along the lines of “fuck the left” or something like that. Or some kind of bizarre notion that BLM is an anti-white movement, or that civil rights are a zero-sum game, or that AOC wants to tax us to death, take our guns, and curb our freedom of speech. (aka maybe the police shouldn’t murder unarmed black citizens, maybe school shootings are bad, maybe someone should be around to fact-check the president’s Twitter account.) Somehow addressing any of these problems would step on the toes of the hardworking white Americans who just want to be free to protect the beautiful, untainted purity of their irish/german/polish/english/italian/scottish/french/dutch heritage.

Oh here’s another rich one: my friend’s friend, the Trump voter who inspired this whole post, hates socialism. He thinks freeloaders will live like kings off of the government without working. He also hasn’t had a job since March and lets his parents pay for his apartment, car, health insurance, and cell phone bill. But thinks freeloaders are a big problem. Huh.

I don’t have a conclusion here, I just was angry and wanted to rant. I don’t know whether to expose Trump supporters to my righteous rage or try and bring compassion to the conversation. Certainly nobody’s heart was reached by yelling and insults. On the other hand, if talking hasn’t worked already I don’t know if it ever will.

I was really hoping the country would sweep Trump out of office swiftly and decisively, and that has not happened. We still might win, but there’s clearly still a lot, a lot of work to do.
